name: "V.R. Troopers" - The Pilot Online Trivia | TV for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: What city did the V.R. Troopers live in?
questions.explanation:
Cross World City.

	Ryan Steele, Kaitlin Star, and J.B. Reese were the three V.R. Troopers. They lived on the west coast the United States in Cross World City. The show was produced by the same team that made "Masked Rider" and "Power Rangers".

questions.text: Which of the V.R. Troopers had lost his or her father prior to the start of the series?
questions.explanation:
Ryan.

	Tyler Steele, Ryan's father, had gone missing some years prior the series starting. Ryan spent much of the series, including parts of the pilot, searching for his father. Sometimes the search for his father came at the expense of his duties to the team.

questions.text: What was being protested in the opening scenes of the series?
questions.correct: The building of a new power plant.
options: The election of a new mayor with a seedy past.
The death sentence of a criminal.
The arrest of the V.R. Troopers.
questions.explanation:
The building of a new power plant.

	Karl Ziktor, who would turn out to be a major series villain, was attempting to blow up a historic building in order to build a new nuclear power plant. There were several people near the building protesting, but they were unable to stop the destruction of the building.

questions.text: The V.R. Troopers had a pet dog; what was his name?
questions.explanation:
Jeb.

	Jeb was a coonhound and officially belonged to Ryan. During the second half of the pilot he was struck by a power surge and got the ability to speak.

questions.text: Grimlord, the main series villain, controls a series of minions known as what?
questions.explanation:
Skugs.

	Grimlord's army are known as Skugs. The other three options are various villains from seasons of "Power Rangers" that aired around the same time as "V.R. Tropers".  Skugs had mostly black suits with gold trim, gold helmets and a cape.

questions.text: The first villain the troopers faced in their transformed state was a giant robotic monkey.
questions.explanation:
True.

	The villain was known as Kongbot. The robot was destroyed by J.B. when he used his Laser Lance to impale it.

questions.text: Which trooper was injured in battle during their first fight?
questions.explanation:
Ryan.

	Ryan was tossed off a cliff and his suit damaged. JB, Kaitlin and Professor Hart spent a lot of time searching for him before locating him on a small cliffside outcropping. They were able to repair his suit and get him to safety.

questions.text: Kaitlin's car had the ability to fly.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Professor Hart made upgrades to her car while they were fighting Kongbot, but failed to tell her. She discovered the upgrades when her car started driving itself and launched off a cliff before it sprouted wings.

questions.text: What was the name of the newspaper that Kaitlin worked at?
questions.explanation:
The Underground Voice Daily.

	The editor, Woody, spent his days playing with toys and otherwise being goofy and strange. Kaitlin worked as both a writer and photographer for the paper.

questions.text: Grimlord and the businessman Karl Ziktor were the same person.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Viewers were aware that the two were one and the same, but no one on the show knew it. In the "real" world Ziktor was a businessman who was bent on earning billions of dollars. In the "V.R. world" he was Grimlord, the leader of the evil forces trying to take of the regular world. When he wanted to transition between worlds he used a crystal ball to help him.
